review: I have had this item since December, and I have not had a good experience with this product at all.  It does not stay connected to the internet, and when I do try to connect, it says that it avoids it due to poor internet connection even though I have the fastest internet offered by Comcast, and my other home devices seem to not have any problems connecting.  This even says my signal is good (see picture).That's not the only problem.  When I finally do get it connected, it does not give me any sound through the TV.  When I called Amazon about a warranty, all they could do is issue a refund (which I was fine with of course).

review: Really great little device that stomps the Chromecast and Roku (I have both)! Boot-up time is very quick, it can be powered off the USB on the TV, can "side-load" apps from an Android device or PC, nice menu selections that are easy to navigate, etc. etc.. Just can't beat it for the price!Only downfalls I'd say are: 1) the method of alpha-numeric input (would be nice to be able to use a keyboard of some kind) and 2) Was not able to side-load Google Play. I realize it is an Amazon competitor but many people use it for music and movies so having a device that can't access your library is a little irksome.I'd also warn that casting directly to this thing from another device is somewhat of a no-go and really needs to get polished up for this thing to dominate the market.
